intro: Anisosperma, commonly known as the African star-of-Bethlehem, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Asparagaceae. It is native to southern Africa and features succulent, fleshy leaves and striking, star-shaped flowers. The plants are often cultivated for their ornamental value due to their vibrant blooms and unique appearance. They typically grow in rocky or sandy soils and prefer full sun to partial shade. Anisosperma species are known for their ability to thrive in arid conditions, making them suitable for xeriscaping.
